oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Differential Effects of Mu and Kappa Narcotic Agonists in the Horse
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Weckman, T. J.
Kamerling, S. G.
DeQuick, D. J.
Tobin, T.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: narcotic agonists
Fentanyl
U-50,488H
μ-receptor
kappa-receptor
analgesia
graduate research
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The pharmacologic effects of selected μ- and kappa-receptor narcotic agonists were investigated in the horse. Fentanyl, a prototypic μ-receptor (morphine like) agonist and U-50,488H, a selective kappa-receptor (ketazocine) agonist were assessed for ability to produce analgesia against a noxious heat stimulus.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AAVPT Biennial Symposia; Sixth Biennial Symposium; 122
